Package com.eclipsesource.tabris.widgets.swipe

Interface SwipeListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SwipeAdapter
    public interface SwipeListener
extends java.io.Serializable

    A SwipeListener acts as a server side callback mechanism of the client side Swipe representation. This means it's methods will be called when the user swipes from item to item. A SwipeListener can only be registered directly on the Swipe object.

    Since:
    0.10
    See Also:
    Swipe, SwipeItem

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void disposed​(SwipeContext context)
      Will be called when the Swipe was disposed.
      void itemActivated​(SwipeItem item, int index, SwipeContext context)
      Will be called when an item was activated.
      void itemDeactivated​(SwipeItem item, int index, SwipeContext context)
      Will be called when an item was deactivated.
      void itemLoaded​(SwipeItem item, int index)
      Will be called when an item was loaded.
